info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 10:04AM EST until January 02 at 1:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Wabash River near Linn Grove. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Secondary roads are blocked. Roads near the east side of Geneva begin to flood. Some evacuations may be required and property needs to be transferred to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 12.8 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.8 feet on 07/08/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
